unnormalised: ## Lights, Camera, Festival! Your Guide to the Awesome World of Film Festivals
normalised: ## Lights, Camera, Festival! Your Guide to the Awesome World of Film Festivals

unnormalised: Hey folks! Ever felt like Bollywood just isn't cutting it? Or maybe you're a total movie buff looking for something beyond the usual masala fare? Well, let me introduce you to the vibrant, exciting world of film festivals!
normalised: Hey folks! Ever felt like Bollywood just isn't cutting it? Or maybe you're a total movie buff looking for something beyond the usual masala fare? Well, let me introduce you to the vibrant, exciting world of film festivals!

unnormalised: Think of them as mini-celebrations of cinema, showcasing everything from groundbreaking indie films to documentaries that’ll blow your mind. Forget your Friday night popcorn flick at PVR, these festivals offer a completely different experience.
normalised: Think of them as mini-celebrations of cinema, showcasing everything from groundbreaking indie films to documentaries that’ll blow your mind. Forget your Friday night popcorn flick at P V R, these festivals offer a completely different experience.

unnormalised: India's got a bunch of them too. From the International Film Festival of India (IFFI) in Goa, which is kinda like the heavyweight champion, to smaller, more niche festivals celebrating regional cinema, animation, or even short films. You might even catch a screening at the Satyajit Ray Film & Television Institute in Kolkata during one of their student film fests – talk about discovering hidden gems!
normalised: India's got a bunch of them too. From the International Film Festival of India (I F F I) in Goa, which is kinda like the heavyweight champion, to smaller, more niche festivals celebrating regional cinema, animation, or even short films. You might even catch a screening at the Satyajit Ray Film and Television Institute in Kolkata during one of their student film fests – talk about discovering hidden gems!

unnormalised: But why bother, right? Well, firstly, you get to see movies you probably wouldn't find anywhere else. We're talking films from Iran, Argentina, even Nagaland! Secondly, it’s a chance to mingle with filmmakers, actors, and other passionate cinephiles. Who knows, you might just bump into Anurag Kashyap grabbing a chai between screenings!

unnormalised: And it's not just about the movies. Many festivals have workshops, Q&As with directors, and parties where you can network and maybe even pitch your own script. Think of it as a crash course in filmmaking AND a killer party.
normalised: And it's not just about the movies. Many festivals have workshops, Q and As with directors, and parties where you can network and maybe even pitch your own script. Think of it as a crash course in filmmaking AND a killer party.

unnormalised: So, how do you get involved? Check out websites like Film Freeway for listings of festivals, both big and small. Many require registration fees, like Rs. 500 or Rs. 1000 for a day pass, but trust me, it’s worth it!
normalised: So, how do you get involved? Check out websites like Film Freeway for listings of festivals, both big and small. Many require registration fees, like rupees five hundred or rupees one thousand for a day pass, but trust me, it’s worth it!

unnormalised: Also, don't be afraid to travel! There are cool festivals happening all over India, from the mountains of Dharamshala to the beaches of Kerala. A few hundred kms is worth the experience. Plus, think of all the delicious food you'll get to try!
normalised: Also, don't be afraid to travel! There are cool festivals happening all over India, from the mountains of Dharamshala to the beaches of Kerala. A few hundred kilometers is worth the experience. Plus, think of all the delicious food you'll get to try!

unnormalised: So, ditch the same old routine and dive into the world of film festivals. You might just discover your new favourite director, your next big inspiration, or at least some seriously awesome movies to brag about to your friends. Happy watching!
